content: I'm trying to solve an issue with HUGE menus which result in timeouts when trying to edit their menu items (not looking to implement mega-menus here - just menus with 100s or 1000s of items in them). I know that there's https://www.drupal.org/project/bigmenu but at some point, I think that there was a contrib module that would allow you to insert entire menus as menu items into a "master menu"; the result was that each "submenu" was managed separately, and the "master" menu had less items to deal with. Unfortunately, I cannot recall the name of that contrib, and I am not able to locate it. Perhaps others have either better memory or better google-fu than myself.
...that contrib I'm talking about had a similar UI to https://www.drupal.org/project/menu_attach_block and/or https://www.drupal.org/project/menu_views (but it's neither of these 2 contrib).
Unfortunately not @mazze.ch ...I am looking for a way to split menu item management into smaller chunks - not looking for a mega menu implementation.
@klonos it's been years since I used the module for a D7 site... but I guess I could place several menus in several blocks and fit them together into one.

@klonos If I get you right, you're searching for something like menu_block - https://www.drupal.org/project/menu_block I just realized, it's not yet ported to Backdrop. (I bet we'll need it) With that module it's easy to cut large menus in smaller chunks.
Ah, wait, that's in core! @klonos you should be able to do that with the "Starting level" and the "Maximum depth" setting of menu blocks.

Thanks for chiming in @indigoxela but also not exactly. The goal is not to split the menus during render time - it is to split the menu management UI. The original issue being that when there are too many items, there are errors about php max_input_vars (because there are too many checkboxes in the form).

...also, FTR, I am not trying to solve an issue with Backdrop or a Backdrop site; this issue is coming up at work with various customers in the GovCMS Platform ...I am just trying to remember a contrib module that I vaguely recall being available for Drupal.
...I remember coming across this module many many years ago, but I just cannot find it in d.org any more.
I know there was one for Taxonomy; Taxonomy Manager or something like that...
Yes @BWPanda (Peter) ...and the equivalent for menus is https://www.drupal.org/project/bigmenu I guess.

I know @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) :sweat_smile: ...trying to avoid that if there's a contrib that does that already. ...ideally, there'd be one with an interface like https://www.drupal.org/project/menu_views where you can select other menus to be "injected" as menu items into a "master" menu. That way, huge menus would be able to be "split" into smaller ones, which content editors would then be able to manage w/o getting fatals and timeouts.
...perhaps this could be my first contrib module :slight_smile:
there you go ... see a need, fill a need.
